New Records: Quinton de Kock slammed the highest score so far in the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023
Key Match Events: South Africa reached a huge first-innings total of 382/5
Heinrich Klaasen fell narrowly short of his century, departing for 90 from 49 balls
David Miller finished with 34 from just 15 deliveries
Mahmudullah scored a fighting century for Bangladesh
Litton Dasâ€™s brave resistance finally came to an end when he was trapped leg before by Kagiso Rabada for a 44-ball 22
Mahmudullah picked pace later on in the innings and belted some big hits out of the ground
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa, led by Aiden Markram again in the absence of Temba Bavuma, won the toss and chose to bat first
Shakib Al Hasan, who replaced Towhid Hridoy in the playing XI, added that he didn't mind bowling first, embracing the opportunity to attempt to restrict the opponents to a reasonable total
Post-Match Reflections: Victory sends South Africa second in the table with four wins to their name and comfortably the best net run rate out of all ten teams in the tournament
Bangladesh slip below England to the foot of the standings
Miscellaneous Highlights: The South Africa openers started positively, although they were assisted by a dropped chance in the second over
South Africa pacers showed top form against Bangladesh in Mumbai
The all-rounder missed out on a hat-trick as his attempted yorker turned into an easily defended full toss
